oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Infectious Bovine Keratoconjunctivitis Management
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: O'Connor, Annette M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine keratoconjunctivitis
epidemiology
IBK
putative causes
control program
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis is a disease that affects many herds in the US, however, the epidemiology of the disease is complicated and control is frustrating for many producers. This article discusses putative causes of IBK and approaches to understanding the causes of success and apparent failure in IBK control programs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2007; 66-70
